docs.snippet: Manchester City and United also posted victories, but Southampton passed West Ham to land in fourth place....

headline.main: Chelsea and Top 2 Pursuers Win in Premier League
headline.print_headline: Chelsea Wins; Top 2 Pursuers Keep Pace

docs.abstract: Soccer Roundup; Chelsea beats West Ham, 2-0, and Manchester City tops West Bromwich Albion, 3-1, maintaining top two spots in Premier League title chase; other soccer news noted.
docs.lead_paragraph: Manchester City and United also posted victories, but Southampton passed West Ham to land in fourth place.

docs.snippet: The ill-fated introduction in Britain of an app to detect predictors of suicide shows what may happen when social media posts are scrutinized for cues about a person’s mental health....

headline.main: Risks in Using Social Media to Spot Signs of Mental Distress
headline.print_headline: Risks in Using Social Posts to Spot Signs of Distress

docs.abstract: British suicide-prevention group The Samaritans face backlash with web application that alerts users to Twitter postings that contain phrases that signal mental distress, and later disable app; critics say analyzing social media activity for signs of mental health conditions amounts to quackery; researchers and psychologists who are studying issue say they will proceed as cautiously and transparently as possible with developing such diagnostic tools.
docs.lead_paragraph: The ill-fated introduction in Britain of an app to detect predictors of suicide shows what may happen when social media posts are scrutinized for cues about a person’s mental health.

docs.snippet: Three South Korean workers died Friday after apparently inhaling toxic gas at a construction site for a nuclear plant being built by South Korea’s monopoly nuclear power company, which has come under recent threats by hackers, a company official...

headline.main: South Korea: 3 Die at Nuclear Plant’s Construction Site
headline.print_headline: South Korea: 3 Die at Nuclear Plant’s Construction Site

docs.lead_paragraph: Three South Korean workers died Friday after apparently inhaling toxic gas at a construction site for a nuclear plant being built by South Korea’s monopoly nuclear power company, which has come under recent threats by hackers, a company official said.

docs.snippet: A radio station funded by the American government says its office in Baku, the capital, has been raided by prosecutors who claim to have a court decision to shut it down....

headline.main: Azerbaijan: Prosecutors Raid Radio Station Funded by U.S.
headline.print_headline: Azerbaijan: Prosecutors Raid Radio Station Funded by U.S.

docs.lead_paragraph: A radio station funded by the American government says its office in Baku, the capital, has been raided by prosecutors who claim to have a court decision to shut it down.

docs.snippet: Advocates worry about how prosecutors will apply a sweeping law decreed by the new military-backed president as a tool to fight terrorism....

headline.main: Human Rights Groups in Egypt Brace for Crackdown Under New Law
headline.print_headline: Human Rights Groups in Egypt Brace for Crackdown Under New Law

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

docs.abstract: Rights activists in Egypt say new law enacted by military-backed Pres Abdel Fattah el-Sisi is sign that Egypt is becoming more repressive police state; law, intended to fight terrorism, imposes potential life sentence for any crime interpreted as harmful to country.
docs.lead_paragraph: Advocates worry about how prosecutors will apply a sweeping law decreed by the new military-backed president as a tool to fight terrorism.

docs.snippet: Is the concept of a meritocracy in the technology industry a myth?...
docs.abstract: Joe Nocera Op-Ed column submits that unconscious bias lies behind continued dominance of while, male workers and entrepreneurs in Silicon Valley; challenges notion, advanced by some, that Silicone Valley is meritocracy, noting low percentages of black and female workers there; says it is common for people to want to be surrounded by others like themselves, and that this impulse is at work in tech industry.
docs.lead_paragraph: Is the concept of a meritocracy in the technology industry a myth?

docs.snippet: Even executives at the wireless phone companies say their industry has created a confounding abundance of competing plans....

headline.main: A Flurry of Varying Cellphone Offers Sows Confusion Among Consumers
headline.print_headline: A Flurry of Varying Cellphone Offers Sows Confusion Among Consumers

docs.abstract: Proliferation of competing wireless phone plans of varying complexity have confused cellphone customers and, in some cases, even wireless phone company executives; competition was spurred by T-Mobile's decision to scrap traditional two-year contract, starting a trend that makes it impossible for companies to expect consumers to realistically compare and navigate range of offerings.
docs.lead_paragraph: Even executives at the wireless phone companies say their industry has created a confounding abundance of competing plans.

docs.snippet: Mayor Martin Walsh of Boston said that public school officials and teachers’ union leaders had agreed to add 40 minutes to the school day....

headline.main: Massachusetts: Boston to Extend School Day
headline.print_headline: Massachusetts: Boston to Extend School Day

docs.abstract: Boston public school officials and teachers’ unions have agreed to add 40 minutes to the school day, move aimed at improving students' learning.
docs.lead_paragraph: Mayor Martin Walsh of Boston said that public school officials and teachers’ union leaders had agreed to add 40 minutes to the school day.

docs.snippet: The company said it would resume serving all portion sizes of fries on Jan. 5 after resolving an inventory crunch stemming from labor disruptions on the West Coast of the United States....

headline.main: McDonald’s in Japan Resolves Fry Shortage
headline.print_headline: McDonald’s in Japan Resolves Fry Shortage

docs.abstract: McDonald's says it will resume serving all portions of French fries in Japan after limiting customers to only orders of small fries in December due to inventory shortage.
docs.lead_paragraph: The company said it would resume serving all portion sizes of fries on Jan. 5 after resolving an inventory crunch stemming from labor disruptions on the West Coast of the United States.

docs.snippet: Four decades ago, a Senate committee’s revelations about abuses committed by the intelligence community led to major alterations at the C.I.A. But times have changed....

headline.main: After Scrutiny, C.I.A. Mandate Is Untouched
headline.print_headline: After Scrutiny, C.I.A. Mandate Is Untouched

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

docs.abstract: Senate Intelligence Committee's report on Central Intelligence Agency excesses since the Sept 11 terrorist attacks is unlikely to result in any significant change in how the CIA fits into the operations of America's secret wars; Congressional, White House and public support for clandestine operations are all strong in an era of deep fears over global terrorism and the rise of the brutal Islamic State.
docs.lead_paragraph: Four decades ago, a Senate committee’s revelations about abuses committed by the intelligence community led to major alterations at the C.I.A. But times have changed.
